title: Creamy au Gratin Potatoes Recipe
description: Au gratin potatoes made with thinly sliced potatoes and onions baked in a decadently rich and creamy Cheddar cheese sauce until tender and bubbling.

Recipes Creamy au Gratin Potatoes 4.7 (5,994) 4,635 Reviews 452 Photos These au gratin potatoes are my husband's favorite — he considers it a special occasion every time I make them! The creamy cheese sauce and tender potatoes in this classic French dish make a delicious flavor combination. Experiment with different cheeses for variety. Serve potatoes au gratin with a roast pork loin or beef tenderloin, alongside a green salad. Submitted by Cathy Martin Updated on October 29, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 452 452 452 452 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 30 mins Total Time: 2 hrs Servings: 4 Yield: 1 (2-quart) casserole Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe There's nothing like au gratin potatoes to take any meal over the top. The creamy, decadent, and oh-so satisfying recipe is sure to please everyone at your table. Au Gratin Potatoes Ingredients These are the ingredients you'll need to make this top-rated au gratin potatoes recipe: Potatoes: This recipe starts with thinly sliced Russet potatoes. You can substitute Yukon gold, if you like.Onion: Slice one onion into rings to layer with the potatoes.Seasonings: These creamy au gratin potatoes are simply seasoned with just salt and pepper.Butter and flour: The cheese sauce starts with a roux made with butter and all-purpose flour.Milk: Make sure you slowly whisk in the milk to create the creamiest consistency.Cheese: Because isn't everything better with shredded Cheddar? How to Make Au Gratin Potatoes You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make these creamy potatoes au gratin: Assemble the casserole: Layer half of the potatoes in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Season. Layer onion slices over top, then top with remaining potatoes. Season again.Make the sauce: Melt the butter in a saucepan. Gradually whisk in flour and salt and cook for about 1 minute. Gradually whisk in the milk. Cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture has thickened. Stir in the cheese.Bake the casserole: Pour the sauce over the potatoes. Cover the dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven until the potatoes are tender and the sauce is bubbling. Au Gratin vs. Scalloped Potatoes Au gratin potatoes and scalloped potatoes are both creamy, rich, and starchy side dishes. But they're not quite the same thing: Au gratin potatoes are usually sliced slightly thinner than their scalloped counterparts. Also, scalloped potatoes traditionally don't include cheese (but more modern recipes can incorporate cheese into the mix). Allrecipes Magazine How to Serve Au Gratin Potatoes Some reviewers say they like to serve these au gratin potatoes alone as a complete meal (and there's certainly nothing wrong with that). Of course, it makes a great side dish for so many of your favorite meals — and it would be a great addition to any holiday table. Reheat, covered with foil, in an oven preheated to 375 degrees F until heated through and bubbly. Allrecipes Can You Freeze Au Gratin Potatoes? We don't recommend freezing au gratin potatoes, as it's extremely dairy-rich. Dairy products, like milk and cheese, tend to separate during the freezing and thawing process. "Fantastic," according to Dianna P. "The entire family enjoyed it and asked for it to be a regular! I doubled the recipe and added leftover diced ham. No other substitutions needed!" "We love this recipe," says becs. "I microwaved the potatoes to cut down on oven time, added some garlic and Cajun seasoning (we like some kick) and it was awesome! I have used this sauce for mac and cheese and it was great!" Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 medium russet potatoes, thinly sliced 1 medium onion, sliced into rings salt and ground black pepper to taste 3 tablespoons butter 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour ½ teaspoon salt 2 cups milk 1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Butter a 2-quart casserole dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Layer 1/2 of the potatoes in the bottom of the prepared casserole dish; season with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Layer onion slices over top, then top with with remaining potatoes. Season again with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Gradually whisk in flour and salt and cook, whisking constantly until raw flour flavor has cooked off, about 1 minute. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Gradually add milk, about 1/4 cup at a time, whisking well after each addition to incorporate; the gradual addition and whisking of milk will help avoid lumps in your sauce. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture has thickened, 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in cheese all at once; continue stirring until melted, 30 to 60 seconds. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour cheese sauce over the potatoes, and cover the dish with aluminum foil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are tender and sauce is bubbly, about 1 ½ hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tip For best results, slice the potatoes into 1/4-inch (or thinner) slices. Use a mandoline slicer if you have one. I Made It Print 9,995 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Creamy au Gratin Potatoes 01 of 452 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 452 Photo by  Liana Aker 01/20/2025 A keeper! Easy to follow I just made this and it is Wonderful au gratin!Perfect amount of sauce to cover taters completely yet stays put really well, not draining to the bottom of the dish. I used 1 1/2 c cream with 1/2 c added water and used a white hard cheddar because this is what I had on hand. Also added t tbsp parsley. 03 of 452 Photo by  Johanna T 09/21/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Family favorite This recipe was amazing!! I used yellow potatoes instead of the Idaho and since I’m also a cheese lover, not only did I add sharp cheddar as directed but also added Gouda and Pepper Jack cheese. Delicious!!! I apologize but started eating before I remembered to take the picture. Absolutely delicious!, and I will NEVER go back to boxed Au gratin potatoes again. 04 of 452 Photo by  TrustyDuck6665 03/27/2024 Don’t put the cheese in all at once, gradually add it in and let it melt slowly. If the sauce is too hot when you add the cheese, your cheese sauce can become grainy. 05 of 452 Photo by  Donna Gluecklich-Sullivan 01/24/2024 This is perfect! I did add garlic to the butter and put some green onions on the top. Otherwise followed it exactly! 06 of 452 Photo by  HouCon 12/29/2023 For starters, this recipe requires a TWO QUART dish, not one quart (typo?). I made this for the first time last night and used half of the recommended onions. When I make it again, I will probably dice the onions and maybe sauté them first. Otherwise, it came out well and was creamy and delicious! 07 of 452 Photo by  LoveFoodnDrink 12/08/2023 It was a good guide rather than a recipe. I caramelized the onions and I put a bit of dry mustard in the cheese sauce for zing. I topped with Parmesan for flavour and crispy top. 08 of 452 Photo by  SnazzyBrew1861 11/01/2023 Made this today and it was delicious. I don't like eating onion pieces so I grated the onions and cooked them in the butter added some dried thyme and dried oregano, a dash of garlic seasoning, salt, and pepper. I let this simmer until the onion was soft( might be a good suggestion for those who said the recipe was a bit bland for them). I used 1 cup of milk and 1 cup full cream. Omitted the flower and used a white sauce instant thickener. I baked covered for about 58 minutes then uncovered and let it cook through until brown on the top. It did not require the full time for cooking I think because there was enough liquid and the potatoes were thinly sliced. Thank you for the recipe. 09 of 452 Photo by  SwiftSauce5143 09/26/2023 I loved this recipe! I definitely added a lot to it, I like tons of flavor, and had ham I wanted to use. I didn’t layer the potatoes and onions, I just tossed them in salt and pepper and a bit of chicken stock. I added ham as well.For the sauce I added a lot of garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper, dried parsley, and a little bit of yellow mustard. I also used Parmesan + cheddar mix.
